message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This study uses data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys and the United Nations International Trade Statistics Database to investigate the effect of trade on firm innovation in developing countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "United Nations International Trade Statistics Database"], "topic": ["Trade", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "To explore gender inequality in access to education, we analyze data from the Gender at Work database and the UNESCO Institute for Statistics.", "dataset": ["Gender at Work database", "UNESCO Institute for Statistics"], "topic": ["Education", "Gender"]}, {"sentence": "We assess the relationship between economic growth and carbon emissions using data from the World Development Indicators and the Carbon Dioxide Information Analysis Center.", "dataset": ["World Development Indicators", "Carbon Dioxide Information Analysis Center"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "To examine the effect of extractive industries on regional development, we use a panel dataset composed of regional economic indicators and mineral production data from the British Geological Survey.", "dataset": ["panel dataset composed of regional economic indicators", "mineral production data from the British Geological Survey"], "topic": ["Extractive Industries", "Regional Integration"]}, {"sentence": "Our analysis utilizes survey data from the International Labor Organization and the World Health Organization Global Health Observatory to examine the impact of workplace stress on worker productivity.", "dataset": ["International Labor Organization", "World Health Organization Global Health Observatory"], "topic": ["Health", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "This paper combines data from the Commodity Price Statistics of the IMF and the United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD) with input-output tables to analyze the role of global value chains in the transmission of commodity price shocks.", "dataset": ["Commodity Price Statistics of the IMF", "United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD)"], "topic": ["Trade", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "We use a dataset on over 1,000 public-private partnerships compiled by the World Bank Group to examine the effect of government guarantees on private investment in infrastructure projects.", "dataset": ["dataset on over 1,000 public-private partnerships compiled by the World Bank Group"], "topic": ["Public-Private Partnerships", "Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "To investigate the effects of climate change on crop yields, we utilize a combination of satellite-derived climate data from the European Space Agency and crop yield data from the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations.", "dataset": ["satellite-derived climate data from the European Space Agency", "crop yield data from the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "Our study employs data from the World Values Survey and the Afrobarometer to compare citizen satisfaction with governance in African countries.", "dataset": ["World Values Survey", "Afrobarometer"], "topic": ["Governance", "Fragility, Conflict, and Violence"]}, {"sentence": "This research uses a unique combination of household survey data from the Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture and the Demographic and Health Survey to analyze the impact of agricultural productivity on child nutrition.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture", "Demographic and Health Survey"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Nutrition"]}]
